intro: Achillios, commonly known as yarrow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its flat, composite flower heads that range from white to pink or red, depending on the species. The plant has feathery, aromatic leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Achillios typically grows in dry, sunny environments and is native to temperate regions of Europe, Asia, and North America. It is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used for centuries to treat various ailments.
